title: CEPPatternDefinition_v1
description: Defines the structure for a declarative Complex Event Processing (CEP) pattern used by the CEP_Agent.

id.description: A unique identifier for the pattern (e.g., 'tsd-adr-sla-violation').

version.description: The semantic version of this pattern definition.

description.description: A human-readable explanation of what the pattern detects.

author.description: The name or team responsible for maintaining this pattern.

tags.description: A list of keywords for categorizing the pattern (e.g., 'compliance', 'sla', 'quality').

pattern.description: The core logic of the pattern to be executed by the CEP engine.

correlateBy.description: An array of JSONPath expressions to fields in the event payload used to correlate events in the sequence.

within.description: The total time window in which the entire pattern must match. This defines the maximum lifetime of a pattern instance from the first event.

sequence.description: An ordered list of event steps that define the pattern. The sequence is defined by the array order.

name.description: A logical name for this step in the pattern (e.g., 'Trigger', 'FollowUp', 'AbsenceCheck').

eventType.description: The 'type' of the event to match for this step. Used for positive event matches.

where.description: A condition (e.g., using a simple expression language) to filter events based on their payload. Applies to both positive and negative matches.

notFollowedBy.description: A negative condition. This step asserts that no event matching these criteria occurs within a given time window after the previous step.

within.description: The time window, relative to the timestamp of the preceding event, during which the absence of the specified event is enforced.
